author: Srivatsan Sridhar
title: Airtel, Vodafone and Idea take on Reliance Jio with unlimited calling and data bundle
text:
Youtube Airtel, Vodafone and Idea take on Reliance Jio with unlimited calling and data bundle 
After Reliance Jio’s Prime membership offer Airtel started rolling out new bundled packs with unlimited data and calls for select users from last week. Now Airtel, Vodafone and Idea calling have started offering unlimited calling packs along with data bundle to take on Jio. 
Airtel is offering two packs, the Rs. 145 pack offers unlimited local and national calls along with 2GB of data per month and the Rs. 343 (Up to Rs. 349) pack will offer unlimited calls to any network as well as 1GB of data per day (500 MB during day and 500 between 3am and 5am). 
Airtel says that the offer is available only till March 31st as a Special Tariff Vouchers and those who recharge in March will get the same benefits for the next 12 months. Bharti #Airtel Unlimited Prepaid Plans (Data+Calls) v/s Reliance #Jio 's Unlimited Plans (Data + Calls). What's your opinion ? RT & Reply pic.twitter.com/FeSMHGAQa1 — SANJAY BAFNA (@sanjaybafna) March 3, 2017 
Vodafone on the other hand is offering Rs. 346 and Rs. 342 (up to Rs. 347 depending on the circle) packs. The Rs. 346 pack unlimited calls to any network and 10GB of data with 28 days validity. — Mohamed Rasik Fareed (@mohamedrasikfa2) March 3, 2017 
The Rs. 342 pack offers unlimited calls to any network along with 56GB data (1GB per day FUP) with 56 days validity. Vodafone also says that the offer will continue for 1 year if you recharge by March 15th. 
Idea Cellular has also introduced a bundled plan that offers 14GB 4G data (500MB per day FUP) along with unlimited calls to any network at Rs. 345 per month. 
All these offers are available only for selected customers and is not available for all. These plans might go official soon.
